Row.Text: Of all our dreams today there is none more important - or so hard to realise - than that of peace in the world. We pray that you have the resolve to do everything that can be done to convert it one day into reality.
I am grateful for the opportunity for us to meet, as representatives of our respective countries. It is my aim that we will develop a strong devotion to the cause of peace.
It is my desire to promote a fraternity between all nations. I hope that you will choose peace, for the only other option will be eventual extinction.
Extinction is the only possible result of the course of your actions.
We know now that in our warfare, fought on any considerable scale, there can be no possible gain for any side. You have brought nothing but waste and destruction.
Your betrayal of the cause of peace is systemic and destructive.
Welcome! Come, let us work together towards the path of peace.
The more we meet, the more our dream of peace comes closer to reality.
I cordially greet you, and value this chance to work closely with you.
Welcome, let us work together.
Let me convince you to walk farther along the path of peace.
Hello again, friend.
Your actions lead straight to war. We must avoid it at all costs. Turn your ways back.
Your systemic destruction of the ways of peace brings unlimited distress to all who speak with you.
The stark and unyielding truth is that your actions lead directly to total war.
The grim fact is that we prepare for war like precocious giants, and you are the worst of these foolish giants.

The land we have is ours by right, we own all of the land the flows into the sea. It will strongly damage the cause of peace if you try to take it from us, because, trust me, we will act to shelter our people.
Sometimes, for the cause of peace, we need to make sacrifices. I am asking you to make one for the greater good of our people.
Your generosity will help to pave the way of peace.
Canada prides herself as a land that is open to all. Let us trade this boon freely between us.
